title: Living Out Holy Moments: The Ascent of the Heart
description:
Matt and Karen discuss Iris Murdoch in a wide ranging romp through the recent history of philosophy: empiricism, rationalism and existentialism. 

Matt's YouTube channel:   https://youtu.be/es11gccQxJA

Matt on Paul VanderKlay's channel. If you’re not subscribed to PVK, I would recommend. This explains who he is.
https://youtu.be/QuUYpLhypUk

And more on Karens’ channel here.
https://youtu.be/V8rbtwJY_

Empiricism and Rationalism line up to a certain degree with aesthesis and theoria.

Books discussed:
The Sovereignty of the Good, Iris Murdoch
(https://www.amazon.com/Sovereignty-Good-Iris-Murdoch/dp/0415253993/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=Sovereignty+of+the+Good+by+Iris+Murdoch&qid=1595649048&s=books&sr=1-1)

St. Isaiah the Solitary

Divine Eros, Hymns of St. Symeon the New Theologian
(https://www.amazon.com/Divine-Eros-Theologian-Popular-      Patristics/dp/0881413496)

Foxe's Book of Martyrs (https://www.amazon.com/dp/0882708759/ref=cm_sw_em_r_mt_dp_U_CT6gFbMYQG30B
